awd_titl_txt: PFI (Conference): Workshop on Diversity in Innovation and Entrepreneurship
awd_abstract_narration:
The broader impact/commercial potential of this Partnerships for Innovation (Conference) project will be on the engagement of about 200 participants from local community colleges and underrepresented backgrounds to learn about concepts, processes and skills for business, innovation, and entrepreneurship as well as inclusive practices, and on creating a template for a scalable platform to foster inclusion and innovation and inspire future entrepreneurs and innovators. The results of the project will be disseminated through presentations and conference and journal publications.


The proposed project will develop a roadmap for inclusive technology development and commercialization. Participants will build knowledge in invention, innovation, technology transfer and entrepreneurship and will learn these skills in the spirit of inclusive innovation practices. We envision this workshop as the first in a series that will mitigate barriers to participation, enable a more inclusive innovation ecosystem and serve as a platform in the preparation and development of future entrepreneurs from diverse groups. The project team is uniquely qualified to offer activities geared towards equitable access and diversification of participation in innovation and entrepreneurship. The evaluation plan will measure outcomes and provide data related to the participants and activities.

This award reflects NSF's statutory mission and has been deemed worthy of support through evaluation using the Foundation's intellectual merit and broader impacts review criteria.
org_dir_long_name: Directorate for Technology, Innovation, and Partnerships

inst.org_lgl_bus_name: THE RESEARCH FOUNDATION FOR THE STATE UNIVERSITY OF NEW YORK

por.por_cntn:
The Partnerships for Innovation (PFI) project on Diversity in Innovation and Entrepreneurship  Workshops aimed to engage participants from local community colleges and K-12 institutions, with a particular focus on underrepresented groups. This initiative developed a comprehensive roadmap for inclusive technology development and commercialization, equipping participants with essential skills in business, innovation, and entrepreneurship. The workshops aimed to reduce barriers, build a more inclusive innovation ecosystem, and prepare diverse groups for future entrepreneurial success.

 

The workshops were designed to address key aspects of innovation and entrepreneurship. One workshop focused on team dynamics, brainstorming, inclusive idea evaluation, and product development, offering hands-on activities and inspiration from industry experts. The other workshop covered risk assessment, market trends, financial responsibility, and business decision-making, including team-based problem-solving and practical demonstrations. Project’s outcomes included educational materials such as flyers, handouts, and presentations, which not only enhanced the workshop experience but also positively influenced participants' academic and career aspirations.

 

The workshops achieved remarkable success, with participants gaining valuable skills and expressing high satisfaction with the sessions. Notable accomplishments included strong high school participation and positive feedback on the interactive elements of the program. Feedback from stakeholders highlighted a clear demand for more frequent offerings and extended exposure to these practices. There is strong support for continuing and expanding these programs on an annual basis to further enhance their impact and effectiveness.

 


Last Modified: 08/26/2024
Modified by: Monica Bugallo
